title: How to Make Dinner Rolls in a Bread Machine

steps.headline: Get your bread machine and read the manufacturer's instructions.
steps.description: This should tell you what order to add your ingredients.

steps.headline: Place milk, water, egg, butter, salt, sugar, flour, and yeast in the bucket of the bread machine.
steps.description: Unless the manufacturer says otherwise, add these ingredients in this order.

steps.headline: Select the dough setting and press start.
After cycle has completed, take the dough out onto a floured surface.
Begin rolling the dough into a circle about 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick.
Coat the surface lightly with butter.
Roll dough into a cylinder shape.
Cut into wedges 3 inches (7.6 cm) big.
Place dough onto baking sheets and cover with towels to let rest.
steps.description: Over the course of an hour, the dough should double in size.

steps.headline: Bake for 10-15 minutes until dough turns golden brown.

text: Preheat your oven to 350 °F (175 °C).  Get your bread machine and read the manufacturer's instructions. This should tell you what order to add your ingredients. Place milk, water, egg, butter, salt, sugar, flour, and yeast in the bucket of the bread machine. Unless the manufacturer says otherwise, add these ingredients in this order. Select the dough setting and press start.  After cycle has completed, take the dough out onto a floured surface.  Begin rolling the dough into a circle about 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick.  Coat the surface lightly with butter.  Roll dough into a cylinder shape.  Cut into wedges 3 inches (7.6 cm) big.  Place dough onto baking sheets and cover with towels to let rest. Over the course of an hour, the dough should double in size. Bake for 10-15 minutes until dough turns golden brown.
